posts.author: David Fischer
posts.title: Here Is Your Chance To Get Your Hands On The VLONE x Nike Air Force 1
posts.text:
The collaboration between VLONE and Nike on an Air Force 1 had originally been confirmed in mid November. Following the announcement, the sneaker got a limited surprise release at ComplexCon. But no further roll-out has been officially announced to date. The for now very limited sneaker is coming to the brand’s Art Basel Miami Beach pop-up store that we showed you this week. But unfortunately, standing in line will not do it this time. You can only get your hands on the sneaker via a raffle. Buying a long sleeve t-shirt from the pop-up will give you one raffle ticket and a hoodie will give you two raffle tickets.
Who Knows You Might Win A Pair Of VF1 (Worldwide) – vlone.co 
A photo posted by V. lifestyle (@vlone) on Dec 2, 2016 at 1:09pm PST 

The shop is open to the public from 12 p.m. to 7 p.m. EST until tomorrow, December 4. Good luck getting your hands on raffle tickets and on winning the sneaker!

thread.title: Off-day for La Salle's Principe at Nike Nationals
thread.title_full: Off-day for La Salle's Principe at Nike Nationals

posts.title: Off-day for La Salle's Principe at Nike Nationals
posts.text:
Off-day for La Salle's Principe at Nike Nationals Saturday Dec 3, 2016 at 3:14 PM 
La Salle senior DJ Principe placed 21st in the Nike Cross Nationals at the Glendoveer Golf Course, Portland, Ore., on Saturday. 
Casey Clinger, of American Fork High School in Utah, won the 3.1-mile race in 15:28.4 to become the first runner to win the event two years in a row. Principe finished the course in 16:01.5 
Principe, who's heading to Stanford, had set a new course record at the 2016 Nike Cross Regional Championships last weekend (15:18) in New York to become the first high school runner to beat the 15:20 mark at the event. About Us

thread.title: Tuohy 13th out of 200 runners at Nike X-C Nationals
thread.title_full: Tuohy 13th out of 200 runners at Nike X-C Nationals

posts.title: Tuohy 13th out of 200 runners at Nike X-C Nationals
posts.text:
Tuohy 13th out of 200 runners at Nike X-C Nationals Nancy Haggerty , nhaggerty@lohud.com 4:42 p.m. EST December 3, 2016 Buy Photo North Rockland's Kaitlyn Tuohy runs in the state cross-country championships at Chenango Valley State Park in Chenango Forks on Nov. 12th, 2016. (Photo: Chris Kitchen/For The Journal News) Buy Photo 27 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Her team didn’t get to go, which was a big disappointment. But North Rockland freshman Katelyn Tuohy made the best of things and then some Saturday, earning all-American honors in cross-country by running to a 13th-place finish out of 200 runners in the Nike Cross Nationals in Portland, Oregon. 
Tuohy, whose team finished 10th in the U.S. at last year’s Nike cross-country championship and was ranked fourth in the U.S. overall before a sub-par performance at last Saturday’s Nike New York qualifier, slipped from 16th place to 20th after two miles Saturday. 
But the two-year cross-country veteran, who was second in this year’s Class A State Championship, second in the state Federation Championship and fifth at last week’s qualifier, finished characteristically strong despite an extremely muddy course. 
“I’m kind of small. It was hard getting through. I was trying to get some traction,” Tuohy said post-race by phone, noting she tried to step in the driest areas. 
That approach worked, as did her revamped race plan. 
Despite conditions, Tuohy clocked 17:58.5. Last year, over the same, although less-muddy course, she ran 18:11.60 for 49th place. 
Running without her team, North Rockland coach Brian Diglio said, allowed Tuohy to be less cautious, since she didn’t have to worry about going out too fast, fading and costing North Rockland placements in team standings. 
“She definitely wanted to test herself,” Diglio said. 
“While she’s been focused on team all year long and that’s been her major motivating factor, this time she could focus on herself,” Diglio explained. “We changed our tactics a little bit. She wanted to try to go out a little harder and try to hang with these top girls. Running as an individual, rather than as part of a team, changed her strategy and I think it worked out perfectly.” 
Indeed, Diglio had hoped for a top-20 finisher for his young runner, which would gain her all-American status, since that goes to the top 21. 
Instead, she bettered that by seven slots, a “fantastic accomplishment,” according to the coach, who, like the rest of his team, stayed home after North Rockland finished fourth as a team in the New York qualifier and was bypassed for an at-large bid. 
The 14-year-old indicated a calm approach aided her. 
“It’s the most competitive meet in the U.S. all year. (But) I didn’t get too nervous. Whatever happened happened. It wasn’t a big deal. I was really relaxed. I guess it really helped,” she said. 
Colorado’s Brie Oakley won in 17:10.1. 
Elite runners were so close Tuohy missed a top-10 finish by just 1.4 seconds. 
“The compression between all these girls is really good,” she said. “Going into the race I knew I really had to have a good race or I could end up 20th or 40th.” 
In Oregon with her parents but not team, Tuohy bonded with other New York runners. 
“I missed them a lot,” Tuohy said of her teammates, “but I made a lot of friends this year.” 
And many had much to celebrate. 
Five runners from New York finished in the top 20. And New York won the nine-region regional championship. 
New York’s Fayettville-Manlius won the girls national team title for the 10th time in 11 years. 
Tuohy, who said she’d like to return next year with her team, characterized her finish as “pretty cool,” adding she was proud she executed her race plan well. 
Diglio, though, laughed, saying, “She was actually mad she didn’t finish top-10. She said she would have if I were there.” 
“That’s the mentality of a great runner," he added.

thread.title_full: Cross country: NB Canyon’s Worley finishes second at Nike Nationals

posts.author: David Hinojosa
posts.title: Cross country: NB Canyon’s Worley finishes second at Nike Nationals
posts.text:
Cross country: NB Canyon’s Worley finishes second at Nike Nationals By David Hinojosa   6:12 PM Print New Braunfels Canyon’s Sam Worley approaches the finish line of the 6A boys 5K during the UIL cross country state meet at Settlers Park in Round Rock on Saturday, Nov. 12, 2016. (staff photo) 
New Braunfels Canyon senior Sam Worley finished second at the Nike Cross Nationals cross country meet held Saturday in Portland, Oregon. 
Worley, who is signed with Texas, covered the 5,000-meter course at Glendoveer Golf Course in 15 minutes, 35.1 seconds. Worley finished behind Casey Clinger of American Fork (Utah), who won the title for the second-straight season. Clinger finished in 15:28.4. 
Worley improved on his 76th place finish from a year ago. Worley, who won the UIL Class 6A state championship last month, will run in the Fort Locker Nationals in San Diego next Saturday.

thread.title: Nike Presents The Art Of SNKRS – AF1
thread.title_full: Nike Presents The Art Of SNKRS – AF1

posts.author: Andres Carrillo
posts.title: Nike Presents The Art Of SNKRS – AF1
posts.text:
Organically elevating the Air Force 1 s innovative look and deep-rooted heritage, Amsterdam-based photographer and director Joost van Brug first created his signature, symmetrical sneaker images thanks to an interest in his brother’s passion for sneakers and their iconic colorways.
“I wanted to shoot something new with sneakers, and my brother is obsessed with Nikes. To me, his collection is just the same shoe in different colors and a big color palette. I just pick shoes based on the color I like, but he told me the stories behind the colorways in his collection.”
An interest in his brother’s favorites sneakers, and in sneaker culture at large, pushed Joost to explore new methods of capturing their essence. In an effort to create a nonrepresentational image of something as recognizable as an iconic sneaker, Joost ultimately developed a motion blur technique, which captures the colors of iconic kicks as they rotate around an axis point.
“For me, seeing my brother’s collection was just seeing a color change in the same shoe. I thought, ‘What if I just get rid of all the information of a shoe, so you don’t even recognize it as one? If you just have the colors, do you still know what shoe it is?’ That’s how I came up with the abstract motion blur.”
His new abstract technique highlights the iconic colors of Nike’s most eye-catching sneakers, while also giving each shoe a more nuanced, visceral identity.

The post Nike Presents The Art Of SNKRS – AF1 appeared first on KicksOnFire.com .

thread.title: Draymond Green to wear custom 'Sideline Racism' Nike shoes
thread.title_full: Draymond Green to wear custom 'Sideline Racism' Nike shoes

posts.author: CSN Bay Area staff
posts.title: Draymond Green to wear custom 'Sideline Racism' Nike shoes
posts.text:
Draymond Green to wear custom 'Sideline Racism' Nike shoes Draymond Green to wear custom 'Sideline Racism' Nike shoes By CSN Bay Area staff December 03, 2016 5:39 PM 
For all Week 13 NFL games, players have the clearance to wear custom-designed cleats to highlight a cause that they are passionate about. And Draymond Green is joining the movement with his Nike shoes this weekend. 
Green will wear specially designed yellow and blue Nikes that read, "Sideline Racism." On Twitter, Green wrote "I stand with my @NFL brother this weekend in wearing @RISEtoWIN's Sideline Racism shoes in uniting against racism. We stand united @NFL." 
The shoes are through RISEtoWIN, whose Twitter profile states the organization as "dedicated to harnessing the unifying power of sports to improve race relations." 
RISE (the Ross Initiative in Sports for Equality) is a non-profit organization, which was founded by Miami Dolphins owner Stephen Ross in 2015. I stand with my @NFL brothers this weekend in wearing @RISEtoWIN ’s Sideline Racism shoes in uniting against racism. We stand united @NFL pic.twitter.com/jHymLXnhNU

posts.author: noreply@blogger.com (Chris)
posts.title: BREAKING: Neymar Shows Off Nike Mercurial Vapor 11 Boots
posts.text: BREAKING: Neymar Shows Off Nike Mercurial Vapor 11 Boots Saturday, December 3, 2016 Saturday, December 3, 2016 Have you anyhow missed that Barcelona's Neymar will be wearing Nike Mercurial Vapor XI football boots against Real Madrid today? If so, Neymar made sure that his fans are aware of his silo switch ahead of the match as he showed off his brand-new Nike Mercurial Vapor XI Dark Lightning soccer boots on Instagram one hour before kick-off. Neymar Shows Off Custom Nike Mercurial Vapor XI Boots Here are the boots that Neymar will wear today. Neymar's boots feature a different inner sole tha the standard Nike Mercurial Vapor XI Dark Lightning soccer cleats, just as all nearly boots of the pros that are manufactured in Nike's small fabric in the north of Italy. Whereas the standard Nike Mercurial Vapor 11 comes with a blue inner sole, Neymar's soccer cleat features a red inner sole. All other parts of the boot of the Brazilian superstar, who previously received heavily modified Hypervenom boots, including the upper and the outsole, are the same as those from the standard edition. Do you think that Neymar's boot sage is now finally history? Let us know in the comments below.

thread.title: Nike’s Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Arrives in “Baroque Brown” Colorway
thread.title_full: Nike’s Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Arrives in “Baroque Brown” Colorway

posts.author: Brian Farmer
posts.title: Nike’s Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Arrives in “Baroque Brown” Colorway
posts.text:
Visit the original post to see all 2 images from this gallery. 
The return of designer Tinker Hatfield’s ’97 running classic, the Nike Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit, has been updated for winter and arrives in a new “Baroque Brown” colorway.
The one-piece, woven Flyknit upper integrates areas of high breathability, stretch and support, conforming to the shape of your foot for a comfortable, second-skin fit. It’s layered with no-sew films and a DWR (durable, water-repellent) finish to keep your feet dry, while a mid-cut collar provides a snug, supportive fit and enhances coverage in chilly conditions.
The sneaker’s aggressive outsole pattern offers enhanced traction on cold and wet surfaces, while the exaggerated heel provides extra durability. As a nod to the original, a reflective heel counter is debossed with “Talaria” for heritage style and enhanced visibility in low light.
Featuring contrasting turquoise laces, the Nike Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit “Baroque Brown” is now available at retailers like Livestock for approximately $200 USD.
Buy Now / $200 USD

posts.title: EXCLUSIVE: Lewandowski to Become New Nike Hypervenom Face
posts.text: EXCLUSIVE: Lewandowski to Become New Nike Hypervenom Face   With Neymar's switch to Nike's Mercurial boot official since Friday , it was expected that Nike would soon present a new main face of the Nike Hypervenom Phantom soccer boot. And while we do not expect an official reveal of the new main face of the soccer cleat before the launch of the third-generation Hypervenom in early 2017, Nike's website already reveals who becomes the new Nike Hypervenom face. Lewandowski to Become New Nike Hypervenom Phantom Face It is almost certain that Lewandowski will become the new cover athlete of the Nike Hypervenom. A look on Nike's dedicated website for the Hypervenom reveals that Lewandowski is the new cover athlete. Whereas Nike's previous Hypervenom page displayed FC Barcelona's Neymar, the updated site shows Lewandowski. Interestingly, the US website still features the text that Neymar would be the Hypervenom cover athlete, while the page already shoes Lewandowski in the background. Robert Lewandowski is likely the best player wearing the Nike Hypervenom boot featuring the Dynamic Fit collar, and we think that he is anything but a poor replacement. Do you think that Lewandowski is a good replacement for Neymar?   below and vote here for your favorite Nike Hypervenom cover athlete .

posts.author: WSJ
posts.title: With $720 Self-Tying Sneaker, Nike Loosens Ties to Retailers
posts.text:
39:55 AM PST by Red in Blue PA 
Nike Inc. this week begins selling a pricey sneaker with self-tying laces, a high-stakes test of the companys technology investments and efforts to sell more products directly to consumers. 
Since its founding, Nike has predominantly been a wholesaler. But as shopping shifts online, Nike is moving to lessen its reliance on retailers. It wants to double its direct sales to consumers to $16 billion by 2020, particularly as rivals Adidas AG and Under Armour Inc. have become more competitive in recent years. 
That is where the self-lacing $720 HyperAdapt sneakers play a role. The company is offering the shoes exclusively on its relaunched Nike+ app and at a new retail store in New York City, beginning on Thursday. The idea is to hook consumers into buying via its app or visiting Nike stores for limited-edition sneaker releases, which to date has been a near-weekly phenomenon at Foot Locker and other retailers. posts.title: Nike's 'Art of SNKRS' Presents Innovative Way to Showcase the Air Force 1
posts.text:
Nike and its SNKRS app have launched the Art of SNKRS , which highlights an inventive method of showcasing the brand's Air Force 1 shoe. Focusing on symmetry, Amsterdam-based director and photographer Joost van Brug utilizes a unique motion-blur technique to show various iterations of the iconic sneaker. He started off shooting sneakers by way of his brother who was an avid Nike fan. He then learned more about the stories behind the different colorways and was intrigued at finding new ways to capture the essence of sneaker culture. 
"For me, seeing my brother’s collection was just seeing a color change in the same shoe. I thought, 'What if I just get rid of all the information of a shoe, so you don’t even recognize it as one? If you just have the colors, do you still know what shoe it is?' That’s how I came up with the abstract motion blur."
Van Brug's abstract technique focuses on the eye-catching hues set on a rotating axis, while also giving each sneaker a unique identity. Take a look at the mesmerizing video above. 
Read more at Hypebeast.com

thread.title: Now 12 of 12 College Football Playoff teams have been Nike schools
thread.title_full: Now 12 of 12 College Football Playoff teams have been Nike schools

posts.author: Richard Johnson
posts.title: Now 12 of 12 College Football Playoff teams have been Nike schools
posts.text:
Eat it, adidas.
In the interest of corporate brand synergy and marketing, Nike would like you to know that they again outfit all four Playoff entrants.
Any Field. Every Time. #CFBPlayoff https://t.co/EDDQMoQd2V pic.twitter.com/oaZC15tfCd 
— Nike Football (@usnikefootball) December 4, 2016 Alabama, Washington, Ohio State and Clemson all rep swoosh swag. And the last few seasons, the apparel brand has bedazzled up the swoosh to make it really pop. They’ll do it again this time around : 
The Alabama Crimson Tide, The Ohio State Buckeyes and Clemson Tigers will be in the Nike Vapor Untouchable Speed uniform with the Washington Huskies wearing the Speed Machine Hypercool uniform during the College Football Playoff, each featuring a fractal diamond Swoosh on the front of the jersey and pant.
2015:
2014:
Nike sponsors over half of the FBS, and its dominance is clear at the top. Besides outfitting each Playoff team, the other major apparel brands ( adidas and Under Armour) have barely even gotten close to getting a team in the Playoff. In each of the final top 10s of the Playoff era, there have only been two total non-Nike squads. Notre Dame (Under Armour) finished No. 8 in 2015 and Mississippi State (adidas) finished No. 7 in 2014. There likely will not be any non-Nikes in the 2016 top 10, other than Wisconsin.

thread.title: Nike uniforms for College Football Playoff: Alabama, Clemson, Ohio State, Washington - CBSSports.com
thread.title_full: Nike uniforms for College Football Playoff: Alabama, Clemson, Ohio State, Washington - CBSSports.com

posts.author: Chip Patterson
posts.title: Nike uniforms for College Football Playoff: Alabama, Clemson, Ohio State, Washington - CBSSports.com
posts.text:
21m ago • 1 min read 
The College Football Playoff bracket has been set. There are fans that are thrilled and searching for tickets and other fans, like those in State College, Pennsylvania or Ann Arbor, Michigan, frustrated that the College Football Playoff Selection Committee did not include their team in the top four. 
But no one is happier than the folks at Nike football. For the third straight year, all four CFP teams are Nike schools. Saturday's announcement came with the release of four mock-ups of the alternate uniforms for the playoff, all from the Nike Vapor Untouchable line in 2016. — Nike Football (@usnikefootball) December 4, 2016 
As SB Nation's Land Grant-Holy Land noted, the Ohio State uniforms in the promo are the same ones worn by the Buckeyes for the double-overtime win against Michigan. But if Clemson, as the No. 2 seed and "home" team in the Fiesta Bowl, wears its home orange, then Ohio State will likely be in white jerseys. 
The same is expected to be the case for Washington as the "road" team against Alabama in the Peach Bowl. Unlike the Nike Mach Speed template worn by many Nike teams in 2016, the new Nike Vapor Untouchable look features less seams and panels along with the latest uniform technology.

thread.title: Release Reminder: Nike KD 9 The Sauce
thread.title_full: Release Reminder: Nike KD 9 The Sauce

posts.author: Andres Carrillo
posts.title: Release Reminder: Nike KD 9 The Sauce
posts.text:
Nike Basketball will be starting the Christmas season a little early this year as they’ll begin releasing their first Christmas-themed sneaker of the year tomorrow.
Kevin Durant does the honors as his KD 9 will be releasing in this “The Sauce” colorway that you see above. Believe to be inspired by cranberry sauce (that is typically eaten during the holidays), this KD 9 features a full Deep Burgundy upper with Bright Crimson hits on the inner liner and the front portion of the Flyknit. Metallic Red Bronze is then placed on the Swoosh branding on the side panels.
You can pick up the Nike KD 9 The Sauce at select Nike retailers beginning tomorrow, December 5th for $150.
via: Nike 
Author’s Take Solid colorway of the KD 9. Love the burgundy upper, but could have done without the crimson accents.

The post Release Reminder: Nike KD 9 The Sauce appeared first on KicksOnFire.com .

thread.title: The Nike Air Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Baroque Brown Is Out Now
thread.title_full: The Nike Air Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Baroque Brown Is Out Now

posts.author: JuanofaKind
posts.title: The Nike Air Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Baroque Brown Is Out Now
posts.text:
Not only did Nike decide to bring back the classic Nike Air Zoom Talaria, they also decided to create a hybrid version of the model ideal for the winter season, the Nike Air Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit. The newest colorway to drop is the Baroque Brown you see above. Today we get a closer look.
The Nike Air Zoom Talaria Mid Flyknit Baroque Brown is constructed out of a one piece upper with Flyknit material strategically placed in areas for added breathability, comfort and support. The shoe also comes layered with no-sew films and a durable and water repellent finish. Notable features on the shoe include a mid-cut collar, a speckled sole with an aggressive outsole traction pattern and debossed reflective Talaria branding on the heel. Out now, grab a pair of your own today for $200.
 
via: Livestock 
Author’s Take Great hybrid model. I’m not a fan of the colorway, but I’m pretty sure I can find one that I like.

posts.author: JuanofaKind
posts.title: Our First Look At The Nike KD 9 Home 2
posts.text:
Kevin Durant already dropped a Nike KD 9 Home , but this is not that shoe, this is the Nike KD 9 Home 2. a new colorway with some similar features. Donning a two-toned look, this Home version of the Nike KD 9 is done in a Flyknit upper with White thread on the forefoot and Blue mesh on the lateral part of the shoe. Additional hits of White can be seen on the laces, Nike Swoosh and the KD branding on the heel. Below you will find a White sole unit with visible Zoom cushioning. Being that it’s a Home colorway, a little bit of Yellow would have been nice, right? Regardless, the shoe is slated for a February 16th release for $150. Cop?
 
images: Eastbay
h/t: SC 
Author’s Take I like the split-colored look on the shoe, I don’t seem much of a “Home” feel to it, but it’s still a solid colorway on the KD 9.

thread.title: This Saucy Nike KD 9 Drops Tomorrow
thread.title_full: This Saucy Nike KD 9 Drops Tomorrow

posts.author: Renz Ofiaza
posts.title: This Saucy Nike KD 9 Drops Tomorrow
posts.text:
This Nike KD 9 , dubbed “The Sauce,” consists as one pair from Nike’s standout Holiday 2016 12 Soles collection .
As its moniker suggests, the sneaker flaunts a deep burgundy finish that seems to be cranberry sauce-inspired — however, the official backstory of the sneaker’s nickname corresponds to KD’s fluidity in his every move during gameplay, as he’s recognized as one of the most versatile players in the game.
Metallic red bronze accents for its Swooshes across the side panels further pronounces the profile, while an icy translucent outsole unit finishes off its design. 
Retailing for $150, you can purchase this pair at select Nike stockists starting tomorrow, Monday, December 5th.
Images: SNS 
Author’s Take One of the best iterations of the silhouette so far this season in my opinion. Maybe I’m just biased towards the colorway, but, this should be sought after.

The post This Saucy Nike KD 9 Drops Tomorrow appeared first on KicksOnFire.com .

thread.title: NationBuilder
thread.title_full: NationBuilder

posts.author: KTG
posts.title: NationBuilder
posts.text: Capture Moments // Create Sounds // Be happy // Help others smile // and… I just want Nike gear. 37 mins ago NationBuilder Hello Medium, The name is Kam and I am nervous as hell at the thought of folks reading this. I’m exposing myself to a potential onslaught of negative energy, I’ve come across negative energy aimed at the company (and employees), I’m not sure how my fellow coworkers at NationBuilder will react or what they will think, I tend to care less about filtering myself (so there is a high possibility of profanity) and lastly I’ve never done anything like this. I work for NationBuilder, I call myself our “Defender Against the Dark Arts” * (still want my job title switched to that). * Working here is for lack of a better word, different. I use the word different for various reasons and I hope to explain in this post or whatever they’re called on Medium. I have my * ”be the black guy version of yourself that makes everyone feel comfortable around you feeling” *everyday I come into work. This is something I deal with everyday and I’m great at making those who don’t look like me feel ok around me and to wake up and come in and not instantly get that gut feeling is really brilliant. One of the things here at NationBuilder is the idea of being your “true self” and this is something I hold dear to my heart and I do best to, one figure out who my true self is and show up to work being that man. In my short time here I’ve had the privilege of meeting some of the most intellectually, emotionally and socially brilliant folks ever. I get to sometimes have cool dialogue with our CEO Jim, have one of the most powerful moments in my life with our President Lea, bug Amy and Young Thugger (Happy Birthday Young Hater) , dance around the office while I’m in my world and notice Ashlee and A’ja laughing at me and make fun of and connect with the stupefying Jesse C.* (I really enjoy our conversations and growing our friendship). * I could go on and on * (Shoutout to Dom, Ryan and Joe) * It seems that I am somehow able to add to this little community we have in our office and that blows my mind daily. Here at NationBuilder i’ve connected with folks that I developed true friendships with and opened up to complete strangers * (which goes against my survival instincts as a male black) *. This is astounding to me. I have an eccentric, BAM in your face personality (I’m working on refining it) and it appears that folks at NationBuilder accept it. When I hear and read some of the mean spirited comments about the company employees being racist or allowing evil blah blah blah it does bum me out, because I see the power of this overlooked thing called Empathy that NationBuilder is holding and in it’s own way giving to everyone. I struggled with the thought of allowing anyone to use NationBuilder’s product and spew whatever venom they wanted to spew. I struggled greatly with the idea that I have to just sit on the sidelines and do nothing when I see someone becoming the face of something that will more than likely make my day to day life a tad more challenging. I don’t know what changed, yet now I enjoy the thought that there is a platform that gives everyone access. Be it a racist individual, a TRILL individual (urban dictionary it for those not about the Trill life) or one who is strong with the SWIRV * (I’ll probably do another post about SWIRV and the coming SWIRV movement) *I enjoy it because this is one of the few things I know of that gives everyone access. Having access is key to creating change. Change is something this country needs a greatly. I had to think long and hard about continuing to work here because of my being called an “Uncle Tom” by someone close to me. The individual felt that because NB allowed Donald Trump to use the software and me working at NB means that I am aiding an individual who clearly is racist and legitimizing racist thoughts and behaviors for others. This thinking is maybe what led to my change of thought. If NB started saying who could and could not use it’s product where does the line stop? It seems like such a slippery slope and I already think that we are in a catch 22. No matter which side you look, someone will have an issue with what someone else is doing or saying. I ask that folks work to find some empathy and attempt to accept that we don’t have to get folks to be on our side to coexist in a thriving community. Those who have the courage and determination to make a change I encourage you be the change you want and look at NationBuilder, the folks working here are passionate about what they do and more importantly open to learning about the things they don’t see everyday. I am proud that I’ve been able to share stories with peers that have told me it helped them understand the black experience more, I definitely wish we could have more of these discussions. It’s a rare thing to find people who understand that they are ignorant to something and want to become more knowledgeable and understanding. I say this as a man who sees a system that isn’t setup for me to thrive and NationBuilder’s mission gives me hope. Jyn Erso said it best, “rebellions are built on hope.” I have hope that this company can achieve it’s mission and democratize democracy. That shit would be so dam cool. So before you decide to send a Tweet or anything like that remember there is a human (robots haven’t taken all the jobs yet) who sees this and they more than likely are doing what they think is the right thing to do. I hope that this helps someone who could be working on something that will make a positive impact and needed a push about using NationBuilder or anything else. Know that no one here at NationBuilder asked me to do this or has any idea I would be doing this. This is me getting out of my comfort zone and hoping that I can share another voice from NationBuilder. I leave you with a word from a great Wizard I know named Lord V “SWIRV,”

thread.title: Four-star athlete Greg Johnson decommits from Arizona Wildcats
thread.title_full: Four-star athlete Greg Johnson decommits from Arizona Wildcats

posts.author: Zack Rosenblatt Arizona Daily Star
posts.title: Four-star athlete Greg Johnson decommits from Arizona Wildcats
posts.text:
Tom Hauck 
Arizona commit Greg Johnson at the 2016 Nike Football The Opening in Portland, Oregon. (Photo credit: Nike) Four-star athlete Greg Johnson decommits from Arizona Wildcats Tom Hauck 
Arizona commit Greg Johnson at the 2016 Nike Football The Opening in Portland, Oregon. (Photo credit: Nike) 
It was assumed Arizona would feel the impact of Donte Williams ' likely impeding departure for Nebraska rather quickly, at least in recruiting. 
Sunday, the Wildcats lost the centerpiece of their highly-regarded 2017 recruiting class, and it's likely connected to the Williams news. 
Greg Johnson announced on Twitter he "decided to re-open my recruitment" after being verbally committed to the Wildcats since March. Johnson surprised many when he made that early commitment ot the Wildcats, but Johnson picked the Wildcats primarily because of his relationship with Williams. 
Williams' departure for Nebraska in particular is interesting because of how the Cornhuskers have been recruiting Johnson even as he was committed to Arizona. 
Johnson took an official visit to Nebraska late in the season and told the Star afterward: "It was cool, just being out of California for a couple days. The atmosphere was cool, and they are cool people out there so I enjoyed it overall. It was a cool visit." 
With Arizona out of the picture, Nebraska and USC are expected to be the leaders for Johnson, whose decision has wide-ranging impact for the UA. 
For one, Johnson is the recruit that started a flurry of commitments over the summer and into the season, helping the UA get its class as high as 27 players and for a while rated the top class in the Pac-12. Now, Arizona is down to just two four-star recruits committed to its 2017 class: quarterback Braxton Burmeister and running back Nathan Tilford . 
Johnson is rated the No. 2 athlete in the West, according to Scout.com , and was expected to play cornerback at Arizona. 
His departure likely puts the death knell on Arizona's pursuit of five-star receiver Joseph Lewis , Johnson's teammate at Augustus Hawkins High School in Los Angeles. It's long been believed that Lewis and Johnson wanted to play together in college, and Williams was the primary recruiter on Lewis as well. Nebraska has been considered the favorite for Lewis for much of the recruiting cycle. 
It's unclear how this impacts the rest of Arizona's 2017 class, but it's less likely to impact the players already committed as much as UA's targets for the next class or two, namely four-star cornerback Thomas Graham , recruited by Williams and from Rancho Cucamonga, California. 
Toward the end of Arizona's season, the Star spoke with Johnson about Arizona's incoming recruiting class and his thoughts on Arizona's losing a lot of games this past year. Here's some of what he said. 
"I’m pretty sure we’re all going to be successful there (Arizona) next year, and help Arizona get a lot of Ws." "I’ve been watching the games, I know they’ve been dealing with a lot of injuries and stuff, but I’m pretty sure they’ll get a couple more Ws. I know that when myself and the rest of the 2017 class gets there we’re going to change a lot of that. We’re looking forward to getting a lot of wins and a lot of bowl wins." "They’ve (Arizona's coaches) been saying they know what’s going on right now but they feel with the guys committed right now, they recruited them for a reason, and that’s to come in and change things. That’s what they talk about.

thread.title: Nike To Invest More In Direct-To-Consumer Business; Facebook Is Testing OTT Ad Targeting
thread.title_full: Nike To Invest More In Direct-To-Consumer Business; Facebook Is Testing OTT Ad Targeting

posts.author: AdExchanger
posts.title: Nike To Invest More In Direct-To-Consumer Business; Facebook Is Testing OTT Ad Targeting
posts.text:
Nike To Invest More In Direct-To-Consumer Business; Facebook Is Testing OTT Ad Targeting by AdExchanger // 
Here's today's AdExchanger.com news round-up... Want it by email? Sign-up here . 
Get In The Game 
Nike has historically distributed through retail channels, but by 2020 it hopes to double its $8 billion direct-to-consumer business , relying heavily on digital channels. “As shopping shifts online, Nike is moving to lessen its reliance on retailers,” writes The Wall Street Journal. For instance, the kinds of exclusive sneaker releases it’s done with stores are shifting to its relaunched app. It isn’t a coincidence that last week Nike also announced a lifetime billion-dollar deal with Portuguese futbol star Cristiano Ronaldo. 
Streaming Power 
Facebook has been quietly testing OTT ad targeting, Bloomberg reports. “For the past few weeks ... it’s been targeting ads to people streaming certain shows on their Roku or Apple TV set-top boxes. It customizes commercials based on the Facebook profiles tied to the IP addresses doing the streaming, according to a company spokesman.” So far, A+E Networks and Tubi TV are involved. Questions still remain around who should be responsible for ad sales and how revenue should be split, as well as how to measure ad effectiveness (and those are pretty important questions). More . 
Growing Pains 
WPP talked “horizontality” at an investor event last week. After noting growth would be relatively flat, the holding company expanded on its plans to integrate a diverse array of assets. “The more services an agency group and the more integrated a specific team (e.g., Team Ford) is with their client (and involved in more higher-level strategic work), then we think there is less risk of an agency group losing that particular piece of business,” a WPP spokesperson told investors. WPP’s most recent evolution toward this goal is through [m]Platform , which centralizes tech and data expertise. More at MediaPost . 
Privacy At All Costs 
The EU’s General Data Protection Regulation, launching in May 2018, will prevent businesses from using individual data without explicit consent. Ad tracking and targeting companies will have to receive consent at every point in the tracking chain, a requirement that could “rip the digital ecosystem apart,” as PageFair exec Johnny Ryan hyperbolically puts it. "Companies who create value only by using data and tracking people across the internet will have to find a way to build a relationship with the customer,” he said. “They will have their businesses seriously disrupted. Publishers may finally have the upper hand.” More . 
But Wait, There’s More!

posts.author: Jesse Bernard
posts.title: Nike Releases LunarCharge In Striking New Colors
posts.text:
Visit the original post to see all 5 images from this gallery. 
Unveiled only a few weeks ago in its first colorway, Nike follows up with a strong second drop of the brand new silhouette. The LunarCharge combines elements of classic Nikes such as the Air Flow, Air Current, Air Max 90 whilst maintaining the modern outsole of the LunarEpic Flyknit. Available for both men and women, the LunarCharge is designed for unrivaled comfort and support with the Premium starting at $140 and Essential at $110. This latest collection includes a series of new colorways, with the all black and all olive versions being the two strongest ones.
The LunarCharge collection will be available in stores and online from December 9.
Check out these recent videos produced for the global introduction of the sneaker.

posts.title: Venters takes 32nd at Nike Nationals
posts.text:
December 4, 2016 
Advertisement 
Portland, Ore.  Free State senior runner Emily Venters placed 32nd at Nike Cross Nationals on Saturday at Glendoveer Golf Course. 
Running against the top runners in the country, Venters finished in 18:26.9. She qualified for the national race by taking second place at a regional in South Dakota in November. 
Venters took second place at the Class 6A state meet earlier this season.

Posted by: Shay Tags: LunarCharge Nike LunarCharge New Colourways Previous Next 
Nike are set to drop two new colourways of their latest hybrid prodigy, the LunarCharge . The neoprene flaunting bootie adds to its colour quiver with the inclusion of cold ‘Light Bone’ and cosmic ‘Violet Dust’ iterations. The first sees a tonal treatment applied to the LC’s low-top upper paired with a clean white LunarEpic outsole. The second addition sees a berry-flavoured combo mixing a mulberry-hued mesh toe with violet neoprene collar, bolstered with a speckled heel counter. 
Both new colourways will release on December 9 via select Nike retailers.

posts.title: Bears eager to partake in NFL's 'My Cause, My Cleats' campaign
posts.text:
On Sunday afternoon, Sam Acho ’s customized Nike cleats will stand out when the Chicago Bears host the San Francisco 49ers at Soldier Field. The shoes will be green and white, in the hues of the Nigerian flag. And they’ll feature a symbol to represent the hospital Acho is helping to build in the rural African village of Isuikwuato.
As part of the NFL's "My Cause, My Cleats" campaign , players across the league are wearing special cleats in Week 13 to highlight a charity or cause they’re devoted to. Among the Bears participating are Acho and running back Jordan Howard .
Acho continues devoting his attention to spreading awareness about Living Hope Christian Ministries , a medical mission devoted, among other things, to improving medical care in parts of Africa. The organization was founded in 1989 by Sam’s father, Sonny Acho, and continues to help provide for local medical clinics, schools and orphanages in Nigeria.
Howard’s cleats will honor the Pulmonary Fibrosis Foundation . Howard’s father, Reginald, died of that disease when Jordan was a child.
Acho made his first medical mission trip to Nigeria with his parents when he was 15 years old. He was, he says, just a wide-eyed and helpful volunteer on that initial trip, helping to escort patients from their medical check-in to the doctors they were hoping to see.
Acho said he was “shocked and amazed” by how much valuable work was being done through the outreach. It instantly heightened his passion for the cause.
“As I got older, instead of that being my parents’ things, it became my thing – something I loved and cared about,” Acho said. “I started to see the doors I could open. Playing in the NFL, I was telling teammates about what I would do in Nigeria and how we could help and seeing who would come.”
While playing for the Arizona Cardinals , Acho persuaded teammates Calais Campbell , Dan Williams and Ricky Lumpkin to accompany him to Nigeria. Last summer, Bears cornerback De’Vante Bausby joined Acho on the trip.
Currently, Acho said, the Living Hope clinic is undertaking a three-phase project to raise $2 million to build the hospital in Isuikwuato. They’ve raised, Acho says, $250,000 of the $300,000 needed to complete the first phase. Acho is hoping his footwear this weekend will encourage others to donate.
Howard, meanwhile, will use his platform to raise awareness for pulmonary fibrosis.
Reginald Howard was 52 years old when he passed away. In his dad’s honor, Jordan’s Adidas cleats on Sunday will be blue and yellow.
“He definitely inspires me. I think about him every day,” the Bears rookie said. “I know he’s always there with me. Even though he’s not here in body, I know he’s here spiritually. He always motivates me.”
Around the league, the “My Cause, My Cleats” campaign will be omnipresent this weekend.
Bears guard Kyle Long has remained active in assisting his older brother, Chris, with his Waterboys initiative, a push to bring clean water to Tanzania and other East African communities in need. Chris will wear cleats highlighting his foundation and the Waterboys cause.
Acho hopes all the cleats worn across the NFL will spur a positive reaction.
“The hope obviously is that this doesn’t become oversaturated,” he said. “At first, I’ll admit I was hesitant to do this. I was thinking, ‘Man, everybody else is going to be doing this. Two-hundred-fifty players all with their own cause. No one’s going to get the message.’ At the same time, this is something near and dear to my heart and if people can hear about this and support it we’ll be able to provide so help.”

thread.title_full: Nike Mercurial Superfly Discovery - The Making of Cristiano Ronaldo's New Boots in Italy

posts.author: Chris (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Nike Mercurial Superfly Discovery - The Making of Cristiano Ronaldo's New Boots in Italy
posts.text: Nike Mercurial Superfly Discovery - The Making of Cristiano Ronaldo's New Boots in Italy   Nike's pro player boots are handcrafted in Italy. Today, Nike gave us a unique behind the scenes look at the production of the brand-new Nike Mercurial Superfly Cristiano Ronaldo Discovery soccer cleats . The Nike Mercurial Superfly Cristiano Ronaldo Discovery soccer cleats are Chapter 3 of the Nike Mercurial Superfly CR7 story that will contain 7 boots in total that describe his rise from the volcanic island Madeira to one of the greatest footballers on the planet. The Nike Mercurial Superfly Chapter 3 CR7 boot pays homage to the match between Sporting and Man Utd in 2003 when Cristiano Ronaldo was discovered by the scouts of the English club. Nike Mercurial Superfly Cristiano Ronaldo Discovery Located in Montebelluna, the north of Italy, the small and exclusive Italian Nike factory specializes solely in the production of brand's top-of-the-line products and professional athletic boots. The images released by Nike include a tech sheet featuring the colors and materials used for each part of the cleats, the actual mold used to fit Cristiano Ronaldo's as well as Neymar's personal boot as well as images detailing the molding and craft process. thread.title: Jewish Teen Gets $25K Bar Mitzvah Money, Buys 800 Nike Pairs To Donate To Less Fortunate Kids
thread.title_full: Jewish Teen Gets $25K Bar Mitzvah Money, Buys 800 Nike Pairs To Donate To Less Fortunate Kids

posts.title: Jewish Teen Gets $25K Bar Mitzvah Money, Buys 800 Nike Pairs To Donate To Less Fortunate Kids
posts.text:
Jewish Teen Gets $25K Bar Mitzvah Money, Buys 800 Nike Pairs To Donate To Less Fortunate Kids By Amanda Moore   04:00 am Drew Frank loves collecting shoes and turned his passion into helping others for his bar mitzvah project.(Photo : Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images ) 
A Jewish teenager, who received $25,000 for his bar mitzvah, bought several pairs of shoes with his birthday money. But the 800 Nike pairs he purchased weren't for his own use. 
Instead, Drew Frank donated these shoes to less fortunate children in low-income families. The 13-year-old tied up with the Braden Aboud Foundation for his special bar mitzvah celebration. 
The Jewish teen asked relatives and friends to give him cash for his birthday, in lieu of gifts. He initially had planned on buying shoes and socks for the kids at the Beall Elementary School in El Paso, Texas. But he also had extra money to donate shoes to orphans staying at the YWCA center for women and children, Kveller reports. 
Drew Frank said that he's been always passionate about sneakers and wanted this to be his bar mitzvah project. Jewish teens are apparently required to do community service in line with this religious tradition. "So I decided to raise money to buy sneakers for kids who are less fortunate than me," the 13-year-old said, per El Paso Inc . 
The Jewish teen celebrated his birthday in May and had over 250 guests who handed out checks. Then, with the help of the foundation that has been spearheading shoe donations to low-income families, they sought Nike for the bulk orders. The shoes have been recently distributed to the school kids as shared in the Braden Aboud Foundation social media account. Another great shoe giveaway ...420 pair of Nike tennis shoes to Beall Elementary ...thank you Drew Frank who gave his Bar Mitzvah gifts to help kids B STRONG! #bstrong #nike #justdrewit #livetogive #tennisshoes A video posted by @bstrongrunwalk on Nov 7, 2016 at 6:35pm PST 
Drew's parents, Dana and Adam Frank, supported his plan and were more than pleased by their son's idea. "We always try to instill the importance of giving back to the community through volunteering and generosity," Dana told the press. 
Doing philanthropic work has always been a family engagement as the Jewish teen's grandparents are well-known philanthropists Stanlee and Gerald Rubin. The Frank kids have also volunteered for Make-A-Wish Foundation on several instances. © 2016 ParentHerald.com All rights reserved. Do not reproduce without permission. Related Articles

posts.text:
Source: Thinkstock The market seesawed last week, digesting some of the big gains since the election in early November. With 2016 almost over, many portfolio managers and investors are looking to make some changes as the time for tax loss selling is upon us. With the futures trading higher this morning, we may open the week with some solid gains and new all-time highs.
24/7 Wall St. reviews dozens of analyst research reports each morning to find new trading and investing ideas for its readers. Some analyst calls cover stocks to buy, while others cover stocks to sell or avoid.
These are this Monday’s top analyst upgrades, downgrades and initiations.
Air Products Inc. (NYSE: APD) was raised to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup. The 52-week trading range for the stock is $106.05 to $146.01. Its consensus price objective is $148.89. The shares closed last Friday at $144.55.
Arista Networks Inc. (NASDAQ: ANET) was downgraded to Equal Weight from Overweight at Morgan Stanley. The shares have traded in a 52-week range of $52.51 to $96.84. The consensus price objective is $91.73. This could be a valuation call.
I'm interested in the Newsletter Get Newsletter 
terms and conditions   Flowserve Inc. (NYSE: FLS) has the firm’s price target raised to $135 from $123 at Stifel,which maintained a Buy rating. The firm cited the company’s broad exposure to the oil and gas markets for the price increase. The 52-week range is $33.86 to $52.50. The consensus price objective is $44, but the stock closed way above that Friday at $49.42.
McDonald’s Corp. (NYSE: MCD) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Nomura. The 52-week trading range for the fast-food giant is $110.33 to $131.96. The consensus Wall Street price objective is $127.24. The shares ended last week at $118.24.
Nike Inc. (NYSE: NKE) is raised to Buy from Hold at HSBC Securities. The 52-week trading range for the apparel and sports shoe giant is $49.01 to $68.18. With the stock closing last Friday at $50.46, the firm may see solid value at these trading levels.
Raymond James Financial Inc. (NYSE: RJF) was downgraded to Market Perform from Buy at Keefe Bruyette. The consensus price target for the brokerage firm is $70.13, and the 52-week range is $39.84 to $73.87. With the stock closing last Friday at $72.96, the analyst may see the shares as fully valued for now.
Tailored Brands Inc. (NASDAQ: TLRD) was downgraded to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank. The stock has traded in a 52-week range of $10.90 to $19.43. The consensus price target is $18.67. With the stock closing Friday at $19.23, this could be another straight valuation call.
TripAdvisor Inc. (NASDAQ: TRIP) is raised to Hold from Sell at Stifel. The 52-week trading range is $45.95 to $87.50 The consensus price objective is posted at $53.80. The stock closed Friday at $46.46.
Vascular Solutions Inc. (NASDAQ: VASC) was downgraded to Hold from Buy at Canaccord Genuity and from Overweight to Neutral at Piper Jaffray. Shares have traded in a 52-week range of $24.34 to $57.15. With the stock closing at $56 last Friday, these downgrades reflect the $56 takeout offer the company received last week from Teleflex.
Visa Inc. (NYSE: V) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Guggenheim. The 52-week trading range for the shares is $66.12 to $83.96. The consensus price target for the credit card giant is $93.70. The stock closed last Friday at $75.72, and shares are looking up marginally in today premarket trading.
Other key analysts upgrades and downgrades were seen in the following:
Equifax Inc. (NYSE: EFX) was raised to Outperform from Perform at Robert W. Baird however the firm did lower the price target on the company to $130 from $135. The 52-week trading range is $91.72 to $136.27. The consensus price target is posted at $139.08. The stock closed up nicely on Friday at $114.03.
Ferrellgas Partners L.P. (NYSE: FGP) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Citigroup. The 52-week trading range for the stock is $5.04 to $20.85. The consensus price objective for the company is posted at $8. The stock closed last Friday at $5.65.
Kinross Gold Corp. (NYSE: KGC) was downgraded to Sell from Hold at Citigroup. The 52-week trading range for the company is $1.31 to $5.82. The consensus price target for the stock is set at $5.49 The shares closed last Friday at $3.47.
Newmont Mining Inc. (NYSE: NEM) is another gold stock lowered at Citigroup. The downgrade the share to Neutral from Buy. The 52-week trading range of the company is $16.05 to $46.07. The consensus price objective is posted at $43.82. The shares closed last Friday at $33.58 and that was up over 4%.
RSP Permian Inc. (NYSE: RSPP) is raised to Overweight from Equal Weight at Morgan Stanley. The 52-week trading range for the company is $16.74 to $44.74. The consensus price target for the stock is set at $50.59. The shares close Friday at $44.36.
Vince Holding Corp. (NYSE: VNCE) is raised to Buy from Hold at Stifel. The 52-week trading range is $3.45 to $8.11. The consensus price target is posted at $6.88. The stock close last Friday at $3.90.
If you missed last Friday’s top analyst upgrades and downgrades , they included Exxon Mobil, International Paper, J.C. Penney, Ulta Beauty and more.

thread.section_title: Kith and Ronnie Fieg Are Bringing Back One of Nike’s Most-Sought-After Sneakers – Footwear News
thread.title: Kith and Ronnie Fieg Are Bringing Back One of Nike’s Most-Sought-After Sneakers
thread.title_full: Kith and Ronnie Fieg Are Bringing Back One of Nike’s Most-Sought-After Sneakers

posts.author: Riley Jones
posts.title: Kith and Ronnie Fieg Are Bringing Back One of Nike’s Most-Sought-After Sneakers
posts.text:
Kith, recipient of the 2016 Footwear News Achievement Awards Retailer of the Year , is teaming up with Nike for a limited-edition sneaker release that will have many feeling nostalgic.
To celebrate the opening of Kith’s Miami location, Fieg has partnered with Nike to release what he calls his “favorite shoe of all time” — the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen.” The tan, pink, and white sneakers were originally released as a Japan exclusive in 2001 as part of Nike’s fan-favorite “Concept Japan” range and have remained tucked away in the brand’s vaults ever since. Related The Best Sneakers to Get You in a Festive Mood 
Select friends and family pairs of the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen” will feature custom packaging by artist Futura. Kith/Tyler Mansour In order to capture the original appeal, Kith and Nike have pulled out all the stops to re-create a one-to-one retro that mimics everything from the grade of premium leather to the narrow shape seen on the “Linen” Air Force 1 Low 15 years ago.
Meanwhile, the sneaker’s launch will also call back to its regional availability in 2001 with a release exclusively at Kith’s new Miami location at 1931 Collins Ave. Beginning on the store’s grand opening on Friday, raffle opportunities will be presented on four different days over the course of the next two weeks.
“The timing was amazing, and I am beyond excited to be the one to help reintroduce my favorite shoe ever to the world. 2016 has been an incredible year, and I’ve been able to live out so many of my personal dreams,” Fieg wrote on Instagram.
According to a press release from Kith, this will be the only opportunity to obtain the “Linen” Nike Air Force 1 Low, and the shoes will have a wider release in the future.
If you know me, you know my favorite shoe of all time is the AF1 Linen. Over a year ago I spoke with Nike about officially bringing back this grail. This shoe represents a different time for sneakers, a time before the game became commercialized. Back then it was about the hunt, and you either had to physically travel somewhere to get the pair you wanted, or you had to know someone who knew someone else that had them. I told the Swoosh that if these were to be brought back, they had to be done in a way that would honor its original release. Not only did the quality have to be perfect, but so did the way they are brought to market. Being a Japan exclusive in 2001, we agreed that they had to remain a shoe that wasn't sold online and was solely available in 1 place. Around this time I had begun work on another dream of mine – opening a Kith Miami flagship. The timing was amazing, and I am beyond excited to be the one to help reintroduce my favorite shoe ever to the world. 2016 has been an incredible year, and I've been able to live out so many of my personal dreams. Here goes another one. A Kith Miami global exclusive. Stay tuned to @kith for more info. 
A photo posted by Ronnie Fieg (@ronniefieg) on Nov 30, 2016 at 6:04pm PST 
 
The Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen” is a one-to-one reproduction of the original 2001 release. Kith/Tyler Mansour Ronnie Fieg calls the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen” his “favorite shoe of all time.” Kith/Tyler Mansour The Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen” originally released as a Japan exclusive in 2001. Kith/Tyler Mansour According to a press release from Kith, the Nike Air Force 1 Low “Linen” retro features a narrowed shape and premium leather. Kith/Tyler Mansour Kith and Nike are teaming up to bring back the “Linen” Air Force 1 Low. Kith/Tyler Mansour

thread.title: Here's Why Runners Will Be Ecstatic to Get a Nike+ Apple Watch This Holiday Season
thread.title_full: Here's Why Runners Will Be Ecstatic to Get a Nike+ Apple Watch This Holiday Season

posts.author: Dominique Astorino
posts.title: Here's Why Runners Will Be Ecstatic to Get a Nike+ Apple Watch This Holiday Season
posts.text:
Image Source: POPSUGAR Photography / Ann-Marie Alcantara 
Hi there! We're Dominique and Ann-Marie (POPSUGAR Fitness and Tech editors), and we just spent the past few weeks testing out the new Nike+ Apple Watch . We've both got unique perspectives on what we want out of a fitness gadget, and we'll give you our thoughts on each aspect of the Nike+ Apple Watch, walking you through our experience with it over the past month. 
Thinking of getting yourself the new Nike+ Apple Watch this holiday season? Or maybe giving it to a loved one? Nike let us take these fancy new trackers on many test runs to see what the user experience is like, so we could give you preview of all the awesome new features. Let's get into it! Related: 
Dominique (center), Ann-Marie (right), with Nike running coach Blue Benadum (left) Nike+ Apple Watch vs. Apple Watch Series 2 
Design and Aesthetic 
What distinguishes this from the other Series 2 Apple Watches is the Nike sport band and preloaded watch "faces" with Nike's athletic, minimalist look — with gray and Nike's signature "volt" lime green colors. And that's it — other than the design you get the same features as you would on a Series 2 Apple Watch. 
"When I look at this compared to the other running trackers out there, this is really sleek, stylish, and much more sophisticated. Definitely not your mom's run tracker! I love that I can wear this on my morning run and I don't want to take it off immediately after when I'm getting dressed for work." — Dominique Astorino, Fitness 
"And let's get real, these bands breathe so much easier than the regular Apple Watch band. The regular one doesn't let my skin breathe and since I have sensitive skin, it's not ideal at all." — Ann-Marie Alcantara, Tech Related: We've Got Something Awesome For Every Runner on Your Gift List (Stocking Stuffers Included) Fitness-Specific Apple Watch Series 2 Features 
While you'll get these same features (below) with a regular Series 2 Apple Watch, if you're comparing the Nike+ Apple Watch to other running trackers, here are some highlights to consider that make this model stand out from the rest. 
Waterproof Design 
"For a runner or general fitness enthusiast, one of the best features about the updated Apple Watch is the fact that it's waterproof. This is a huge bonus if you're looking for a tracker and comparing it to others on the market." — DA 
"As someone who does not know how to swim well (I swear I can at least float), the waterproofing is awesome for anyone who's also just into outdoor activities. I went kayaking with the Apple Watch and it was sprayed with water a lot. But with its new waterproof durability, I didn't have to worry about it surviving the trip (or feel like a tool for worrying about my precious Apple Watch while kayaking under the stars)." — AMA 
Music Storage 
"You can store up to 1 GB of music on your Nike+ Apple Watch and pair with your wireless headphones (I'd recommend the Powerbeats3 ) so you can have your running playlist on the go. For me, this means I get to store one running playlist at a time." — DA 
Heart Rate Monitor 
One of the benefits of the Apple Watch is the ability to monitor your heart rate, on the Heart Rate app, through the Nike+ Run Club app, and in the Workout app. This helps contribute to calorie-burning data and your movement data for the day in the Activity app. 
GPS 
"At the end of your run, regardless of whether or not you have your phone, you get a screen at the end that shows you the general route from the GPS. You can then sync to your phone once you've reunited with it (I know . . . it's so hard to leave it behind) and look at your map a little more in depth and analyze where you slowed down, sped up, etc." — DA 
"The map is also a great reminder for anyone on the fitness struggle bus of how much you were able to run. It's also so nice to have the option to leave your phone behind — something not possible on the first generation Apple Watch." — AMA Using the Running App 
While the general features of the Apple Watch Series 2 are enticing enough, the most exciting part of the Nike+ version is the fact that you get to take one of the best running apps from your phone and put it onto your wrist in the form of a very sleek tracker — arguably the sleekest. 
To get started, you'll need to have the NRC app on your phone (and a Nike+ account), in order to install it on your Watch. 
Once you're ready to take it for a test run (literally), all you have to do is tap the Nike+ symbol on your home screen. From there, the app launches and you can hit the start button or adjust your preferences (indoor run versus outdoor, auto-pause on and off). 
Modes: Advanced and Basic 
You can customize the "modes" of your running interface depending on the kind of stats you want to see. When you're just starting out, you might just want to see the amount of time you've been out there running and your total distance. For those of you working on the art of pacing, the Advanced Mode is for you. 
"I use the Advanced Mode because I've been working on both quickening and maintaining an even pace, so this is really important to me. I also love that you can see your heart rate BPM in the top corner, because I've been getting more and more intrigued about heart rate data lately." — DA" 
"I also use the Advanced Mode to know my pace and adjust — especially if I'm training for a race. I also like knowing it so I can show off and pretend I'm a fitness junkie who can talk about pace." — AMA 
"You can totally talk about pace! We should start training for a race together!" — DA 
"If only you'll accept running in the slowest corral ever." — AMA Related: 10 Apps For Every Type of Runner 
Phone-Free Running 
The Watch puts your NRC app on your wrist, so you don't have to carry your phone with you. You can track your pace, distance, total time, and even your route with the GPS feature, and then sync to your Nike+ Run Club app once you're back to your phone. 
"I personally still run with my phone. The idea is amazing, but in terms of safety (I run alone in a city) — and to be totally honest, pictures — I still want my phone with me. Sharing photos of my run routes is one of my favorite parts of the Nike running app. But now, I can leave my phone in my pocket or waist pack — no need to constantly take it out to check pace, distance, etc. — I can just glance at my wrist!" — DA 
"I also always run with my phone, but it's mostly to listen to my curated Spotify playlists and safety. However, on the weekends, it's a great option to leave my phone behind or at least know that having it near means accessing other important safety features that come with the new watch like SOS (hold the side button and 911 gets called)." — AMA 
For those of you who love the NRC app but are less attached to your phone (and perhaps in a safer running environment), this will feel like a new freedom. You'll get all the benefits of tracking your pace, progress, and course — plus the ability to share your run — without having to carry or bring anything extra. 
Auto-Pause 
"Auto-pause is a major feature for me, and it's inherent in the NRC app, so it's nice that it carried over to the Watch as well. It's especially clutch for a distraction-free workout if you're running in a city or anywhere with stoplights. You have the option to turn this on or off depending on your preference, but when you have it on, there's no need to fuss with your Watch every time you stop for traffic or a crosswalk; the app automatically knows, pauses your workout (the classic "pausing workout" message you're familiar with if you've been using the app), and then resumes once you've begun running again." — DA 
"The auto-pause is double-edged sword — and one I'm familiar with since I've used the NRC app for a while. It's awesome that it automatically pauses if you're walking or waiting at a stoplight, but sometimes I just want to take a break from huffing and puffing my way through a mile! Thankfully, though, the watch doesn't account for these breaks (necessary for beginner runners); you can turn off the auto-pause feature." — AMA Accessing Your Data 
If you swipe to the left twice in the running app, you'll get to the screen that shows your total mileage for the current month. For example, it might show four runs for December, with 8.75 total miles. 
Your collective run data — including pace, splits, etc. — and past run routes are all stored on the NRC app on your phone and on your Nike+ account online. You cannot see any of this from your Watch once you've saved your most recent run. Fun Features 
Nike added in some intuitive and fun bonuses that make running more enticing, exciting, and interactive. 
Reminders 
"The 'Are We Running Today' feature is probably one of my favorite features of the Nike+ Watch. If it's been a few days since your last run, the screen pops up like a notification (with the weather info), prompting you to schedule a run for yourself. My first one said "It's 61º with a chance of greatness" and I damn near died with giddiness." — DA 
"I'll admit, I was someone who totally tweeted about how the 'Are We Running Today' feature was a total run-shame move by Nike . But in practice, it doesn't actually remind you every day and it's just like a running to-do list." — AMA 
Scheduling 
If you need the extra motivation or accountability, the scheduling feature is both fun and practical. Once you're in the running app, swipe left to open the next screen, which is the scheduler. It'll show the next several hours in half-hour increments, alongside weather conditions, so you know what to expect when you hit the pavement or trails. 
"If you're training for a run, this is an awesome reminder feature to meet your goals!" — AMA Related: The 1 New Apple Product You Should Buy Isn't What You'd Expect 
Encouragement 
"At the end of your run, cute screens come up with different messages — I've seen a different one every time, actually! I wish they lasted longer. You also sometimes get an encouraging audio message from a famous runner, coach, or even Kevin Hart." — DA Related: Your New Year's Resolution Made Easy: 10 Simple Steps to Start Running 
"The messages are what you wish your gym teacher in middle school would've said to you! They are positive, cheesy, and absolutely awesome to hear and see after finishing a run. It's almost like the words are coming from someone real who wants to see you succeed and get fit." — AMA 
"On the note of getting some encouragement, I also interviewed trainer Jeanette Jenkins earlier this year, who ran the New York Marathon and used the Nike+ Apple Watch to pace her run (she LOVES her watch). She told me that one of her favorite features is that it's more than just a tracker — you get the Apple Watch text capabilities, too. This meant she was able to get texts of encouragement from her nieces and nephews that she could see right on her wrist. 'I wasn't expecting it, so it totally filled me with joy.'" — DA 
Sharing 
Once you've completed a run, you have the option to share it with your fellow Nike+ Apple Watch-owning friends, which can send them a virtual "fist-bump" prompting them to match or surpass your mileage. A little friendly competition. 
"Ann-Marie and I couldn't get this to work between us, but we haven't given up hope. We asked Nike what triggers the bumping of the fists, and they told us that the software is designed to give a more serendipitous feel to the fist-bump — so it doesn't happen every time you run. You also have to make sure that both of you are wearing the watch for it to happen." — DA 
"Since Dominique is a fitness editor, I hope to get some fist bumps from her soon. It'll be a nice and friendly reminder to exercise instead of rewatching Gilmore Girls (again)." — AMA 
"Oh yeah this will be a fun way to be accountability buddies! We have to make this work." — DA 
Beyond the fist-bump functionality, you also can share your run to the rest of the Nike+ community and your Nike+ friends, and from the app on your phone, you can share more to social media. Keeping the positive run vibe alive, and encouraging you — and your friends — to get out there and stay active. Related: Here's Why You Should Get the iPhone 7 Plus but Not the iPhone 7 Beyond Running 
If you're using the Nike+ Apple Watch for activities other than running, bear in mind that you'll be using the standard Apple Watch Workout app. This is not a Nike-specific activity tracker, but you can use it to log workouts like indoor cycling, weight training, and even swimming, thanks to the watch being waterproof. Overall Impression 
"I've never been truly convinced that anyone needs an Apple Watch, but this one finally makes it a worthy investment. With the new watchOS3, bands, GPS, and waterproof capabilities, the price tag on this watch makes sense, and you won't regret having one. It might be the little motivation you need in the New Year to start training for a race (or to pretend like you're going to train for one)." — AMA 
"I love this thing so much — it's been encouraging me to go for more runs because it's literally ON MY WRIST every day, encouraging me to use it. The fact that I can interact with friends through the watch is a huge bonus, too. But my favorite part remains that I can take everything I love from my favorite running app and now use it with wrist-tracker functionality. If I didn't have this one, it'd be atop my Christmas list . . . also, my parents read this, so I can't say if they will or won't be getting one from me, but let's just say that things are looking good for them this year." — DA 
Is the Nike+ Apple Watch right for you? If running isn't your favorite activity, and you're just hoping for simple step tracking or exercise logging, or if you're looking for a tracker that logs sleep (the Apple Watch can't do this as you need to charge it nightly), then you might want to look elsewhere. But if you're looking for a stylish, waterproof run tracker with the added benefits of the Apple Watch (ability to listen to music phone-free, take calls and texts, use Apple Pay), and get a nice friendly dose of encouragement to go on another run . . . then yes, you're definitely going to want one of these to kick off 2017.

posts.title: Technical Reports on Consumer Goods Stocks -- NIKE, Coach, G-III Apparel, and Carter's
posts.text:
Chelmsford Park SA
NEW YORK , December 5,
Stock-Callers.com explores the Consumer Goods sector which is involved in the manufacturing and marketing of products such as appliances, toys, recreational vehicles, jewelry, and sporting goods, among many others. In 2015, the U.S. Consumer Goods market was the largest in the world, estimated at $437.8 billion , based on U.S. Bureau of Labor Standards data. Let us now take a look at today's featured equities and see how they have fared over the last few trading sessions: NIKE Inc. (NYSE: NKE), Coach Inc. (NYSE: COH), G-III Apparel Group Ltd (NASDAQ: GIII), and Carter's Inc. (NYSE: CRI). Download the free research reports on these stocks today:
http://stock-callers.com/registration
NIKE
Beaverton, Oregon headquartered NIKE Inc.'s stock saw a slight decline of 0.38%, finishing last Friday's trading session at $50.46 . A total volume of 6.93 million shares was traded. The Company's shares have gained 1.85% in the last month. The stock is trading below its 50-day moving average by 1.89%. Additionally, shares of NIKE, which together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, markets, and sells athletic footwear, apparel, equipment, and accessories worldwide, have a Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 46.72.
On December 01 st , 2016, Nike announced that for the first time ever, it is launching the best of the past, present, and future of basketball through the 12 Soles Collection, a series of silhouettes that celebrate Nike and Jordan Brand's impact on the sport of basketball. The coveted set of footwear featuring performance and reimagined icons will launch across the entire month of December, culminating with a Christmas day surprise launch. See our free and comprehensive research report on NKE at:
http://stock-callers.com/registration/?symbol=NKE
Coach
Shares in New York headquartered Coach Inc. ended at $36.23 , down 0.14% from the last trading session. The stock recorded a trading volume of 2.64 million shares. The Company's shares have advanced 2.14% in the past month and 13.62% since the start of this year. The stock is trading 0.71% below its 50-day moving average. Moreover, shares of Coach, which provides luxury accessories and lifestyle brands, have an RSI of 40.97.
On November 17 th , 2016, Coach announced the opening of its newest flagship in one of the world's most prestigious shopping districts at 685 Fifth Avenue in New York City . The 20,000 square foot retail space dedicated to the Coach brand, designed by Executive Creative Director Stuart Vevers in partnership with William Sofield , Designer and President of Studio Sofield, showcases the brand's distinctive modern luxury positioning. COH free research report PDF is just a click away at:
http://stock-callers.com/registration/?symbol=COH
G-III Apparel
On Friday, shares in New York -based G-III Apparel Group Ltd recorded a trading volume of 7.12 million shares, which was above their three months average volume of 676,520 shares. The stock rose 3.09%, closing the day at $27.71 . The Company's shares have gained 3.59% in the last one month. The stock is trading 2.55% below its 50-day moving average. Additionally, shares of G-III Apparel Group, which designs, manufactures, and markets men's and women's apparel, have an RSI of 46.32.
On December 01 st , 2016, G-III Apparel Group reported that net sales were $883 million for Q3 FY17 compared to net sales of $910 million in Q3 FY16. The Company's net income for the reported quarter was $70.6 million , or $1.50 per diluted share, compared to $87.2 million , or $1.87 per diluted share, in Q3 FY16. G-III Apparel reported non-GAAP net income per diluted share for Q3 FY17 of $1.50 compared to $1.85 in Q3 FY16.
On December 02 nd , 2016, research firm Telsey Advisory Group reiterated its 'Market Perform' rating on the Company's stock with a decrease of the target price from $37 a share to $25 a share. Sign up for your complimentary report on GIII at:
http://stock-callers.com/registration/?symbol=GIII
Carter's
At the close, shares in Atlanta, Georgia headquartered Carter's Inc. recorded a trading volume of 333,500 shares. The stock finished the session 0.20% lower at $91.90 . The Company's shares have gained 7.02% in the past month and 4.64% on an YTD basis. The stock is trading above its 50-day moving average by 3.77%. Furthermore, shares of Carter's, which operates through five segments: Carter's Retail, Carter's Wholesale, OshKosh Retail, OshKosh Wholesale, and International, have an RSI of 54.95. http://stock-callers.com/registration/?symbol=CRI
